title: If you autolock in blind pick
body: What the actual fuck are you doing outside Team Builder?

replies.body: Probably not waiting 30 min to get top/mid

> [{quoted}](name=Xuldin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oL0XEJaA,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-04-28T02:52:21.017+0000)
>
> Probably not waiting 30 min to get top/mid

It takes me less than 30 seconds to queue up in Teambuilder for mid or top...
same

> [{quoted}](name=Xuldin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oL0XEJaA,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-04-28T02:52:21.017+0000)
>
> Probably not waiting 30 min to get top/mid

"mid" *instalock*
"no, mid or I feed" *instalock*
"i called first troll"
*bitching and moaning at each other, putting at least 2 people on tilt*
(spoiler: both feed)

This is YOUR fault.
Avoiding the 20 minute queue times because I don't want to play support.

While it's the norm that people now expect some kind of team cooperation in Blinds, but know this, Blind was originally made to support auto locking, and ofc was used as such.

Because Draft was and still is a thing.

If you still are playing "blind pick", you are doing it wrong.

There's no point to even play "blind pick" as long as Draft and Team Builder exists. 

RITO should remove that shit mode.

Not all of us want to play Support to be allowed reasonable queue times, so... no.

Also some people like to go off-meta picks, elongating their queue even further. So, again, no.
If there was no blind pick then team builder would have faster queue times though, so... yes.

That's not a guarantee. 

Ever played WoW since Wrath of the Lich King and its dungeon finder? "Oh, you're not a tank or healer? Hope you have something to fiddle around with while you wait for that dungeon!" 

And that's a game with millions of players as well. You really think that, under any circumstance, a rare 1/5 will ever become less rare? It's rare for a reason, and that's because most people don't like to main supports (support on this game, healer on WoW), and that's perfectly fine.
i really hope for a "instalock" report. Really, if you want a lane call it. if you're first go,if not go somewhere else.
Trolls need to troll. It's basically the premise of half the channels on youtube.
blind pick is blind pick..im pretty sure instalocking is the entire idea

> [{quoted}](name=Treyen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oL0XEJaA,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-04-28T09:28:46.884+0000)
>
> blind pick is blind pick..im pretty sure instalocking is the entire idea

Get out.

though i never instalock, i do insta"click" the random button and see who i play as and think of what role i should go. it helps me try new things, like {{champion:78}} mid or {{champion:96}} sup. It may be my low elo, but we usually win, none-the-less.

From my experience, I will quickly say my desired role, select a champ, wait for a reply, discuss disputes then lock in or change based on consensus. Problem is, that there is ALWAYS at least ONE auto-lock, and if the auto-lock guy takes your lane, even if you call it first and everyone agrees, you still have to go another lane or troll. So now, even polite patient people autolock and just hope for the best, because polite people get trolled, while trolls get promoted to hobgoblins :D
I wouldn't say every match but yes it is often. . Like 1/5 matches

I don't play blind pick for this reason. I really don't understand why anyone plays it anyway. If you want to play a specific champ without them getting banned play TB. If you want to practice ranked play normal draft. I've seen a decrease in the number of toxic players I've gotten stuck with since I stopped playing blind pick.
Blind pick champ select is so toxic. The toxicity is what led me to switch over to normal draft. That was years ago and I've never looked back.

Either you autolock or you argue over who called top/mid/adc first. Blind pick is nothing but a circle jerk in pregame lobby where everyone argues over roles, which is why I only play teambuilder or draft.
To all the people complaining about blind pick being a thing, I'd play more teambuilder if I could que up as fill and then pick my champion when I saw what position I got.

Sometimes i just hit random and lock in normals to destress, open my mind to champ possibilities, and force me to get a macro view of the game instead of being so role focused. 

It actually helps me a lot.

insta lock {{champion:17}} 
player 2 says .. i want top..
{{champion:17}} "its okay i will take adc"
champ locked in {{champion:54}} "thank you"
Next champ locked in {{champion:236}} "i am adc"
{{champion:17}}  "okay i will take support 
next champ locked in {{champion:37}} "we are duo bot... go somewhere else"
{{champion:17}} "okay i got mid"
next champ locked in {{champion:238}} "i have mid"
{{champion:17}} "okay" selects {{summoner:11}} 
game starts

(angry team mates) /all report teemo for trolling.

and that is solo normal Que.
Anyone who wants to play support or jungle ques up for Teambuilder because they can get a short queue so all that is left in blind pick is the impatient mofo's who wanna play top and mid.
I want to say avoiding que time for team builder or hiding from ranked so you don't feel MMR shamed, but my crystal ball is hazy on which it is.

permaban op pls
